thread.title: Dallas County court clerk indicted for allegedly faking a notice to evict Mesquite woman
thread.title_full: Dallas County court clerk indicted for allegedly faking a notice to evict Mesquite woman

author: Leah Waters
title: Dallas County court clerk indicted for allegedly faking a notice to evict Mesquite woman
text:
A Dallas County grand jury has indicted a clerk for a justice of the peace on misdemeanor charges of forgery for allegedly faking a hearing notice used to evict a Mesquite woman, according to court documents filed Dec. 23. Lutishia Williams, 53, is accused of fabricating a hearing notice in August 2022. The notice was used as a basis to evict Chantel Hardaway, a Mesquite mother who claimed in a lawsuit that she never received the hearing notice.
Advertisement Related: Mother who says court faked eviction hearing notice still waiting for justice Advertisement The hearing notice alleged to be fake is a Microsoft Word-generated document dated June 14 and signed by Williams.
Breaking News Get the latest breaking news from North Texas and beyond.
Email Address By signing up you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
SUBMIT Williams is the chief clerk for justice of the peace Margaret O’Brien, who previously denied any wrongdoing by anyone in her court. Williams and O’Brien did not respond to requests for comment.
A hearing notice used in a woman's eviction case is under scrutiny after an attorney for the tenant alleged in a suit that a court fabricated the notice, which appears unlike other computer-generated ones. (Mark Melton ) Advertisement Mark Melton, an attorney for Chantel Hardaway, said in court records that someone in O’Brien’s court falsified an official notice after he asked to see a copy of it in the records.
The Dallas County District Attorney’s public integrity unit, which began its investigation in September 2022, seized items from the courthouse in September 2023, according to an October 2023 email from Williams to The Dallas Morning News .
Related: Dallas County district attorney probes allegations court forged eviction notice Advertisement Melton and the DA’s office declined to comment on the indictment.
Advertisement A date for Williams’ trial has not yet been set.
